page.title: 04A DAY AT ST. AUBIN'S FORT
page.content: We stayed at the fort recently, we got up at 7 o'clock and went down to the open air sinks for a wash. Then we had breakfast: cornflakes followed by bacon and egg. We split into groups for work sessions. We might work in the classroom to learn about the history of the fort or we might go out onto the rocks to look at rock pools or collect shells. One group prepared lunch of sandwiches and crisps, we all sat on the gunsite to eat it. In the afternoon the tide had uncovered the causeway and we could all walk over to the land side for more lessons. After dinner we wrote our diary and then had some time for games or to listen to tapes. We got into the bunkbeds at 9:30 and then the generator was turned off and it all went dark, and quiet... then sleep.
